Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: SBC500
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great hotel close to the airport. They have a very professional staff, and the room was very clean. The hotel is located only a few miles from downtown. It is not in the best part of town, but perfect for people traveling through who need a good, clean place to stay with an airport shuttle. The restaurant staff was excellent and the food was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: erin h
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here a couple weekends ago. The place is wonderful. It's quite, the front desk staff was great, the airport shuttle was a plus, and the resturant has good food. The pool and hot tub were a welcome site after a previous night of camping near Tucson. The bed was oh so comfy. Overall, I was very happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Julie L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for a quick weekend get-away and had a great time. The room was very clean, comfortable bed and very quiet overall given it's just a short distance to the airport. We had a little extra time and spent an hour at the pool which was well maintained and a nice atmosphere - no frills but just right. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling through or staying a few nights. The light rail is walking distance so you can get anywhere in the area without a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bob R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found the service and comfort at this Hotel outstanding. The person that checked us in was very professional and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable. We had one of the best Margaritas we have ever had in the Hotel Bar and then we ate in the restaurant. The waitress was helpful and attentive and the food was very good as well. I recommend this Hotel and say that it exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Well-maintained & Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Bob B
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been through several name changes over the years, back again to Radisson. My room looked the same as the last time I stayed here about 12 years ago, though the bedding has been replaced and is very comfortable. Location is very good. Close to airport but no noise. About a block from the light rail which can take one to downtown Phoenix or Tempe. Very clean room. WIsh hotels would figure out that a small investment in a small refrigerator would be appreciated by many guests. My room had a fantastic view to the north to Camelback Mountain and the Papago Park area.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service beyond good.”
Reviews.Author: Twinkiethekid
Reviews.Content: The customer service here was excellent. In todays fast paced society sometimes the consumer loses out. Not here, the staff remembered our names and made sure we had what we wanted or needed. Donna our server/ bartender was excellent even while working a double shift. Nicole and Eric at the front desk were extremely helpful. The hotel was clean along with the room. Pool was secluded from surrounding area. Nice lounge with good beer on tap. Try the Milk Stout from Colorado in a bottle, it was yummy. Also free shuttle to and from airport was a bonus. I would recommend this place to anyone and will stay here if I'm ever back in Phoenix area. Peace

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Barbie V
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness and service are very important to me when choosing a hotel, but price is factored in as well because I love a good deal. I am a regular guest at establishments such as The W, Renaissance, Kimpton, and Westin (or most Starwood Hotels). After researching hotels and prices in the Phoenix area for a business trip, I kept going back to this Radisson property. I was reluctant because the price seemed too reasonable for the amenities offered, and for the excellent reviews....too good to be true, maybe? I took the chance, and booked my stay, and am so pleased that I did. The rooms, as well as the entire property were very, very clean. It is apparent that this is important to them. Gabina was a sweetheart, and payed attention to the "Do not disturb" sign.They were also efficient in their communication to housekeeping as to my late check out. Not a difficult thing, but doesn't always happen that way at other hotels. Nicole and Jenny at the front desk were very courteous, and went above and beyond being helpful and were very efficient. They are an asset to this hotel, and I hope that they are recognized for their efforts. I liked the fact that there was a restaurant on site, as well as a bar area. The food is very reasonably priced, but not the drinks....a bit over priced. Room service was fast, and the food was hot and tasty. Complimentary internet throughout the hotel, as well as a complimentary business center that provides four or five computers for guests were an added value, if you didn't travel with a laptop, etc. The 24 HR airport shuttle service is also great. They run a timely, efficient operation, and the driver was a gentleman. I feel bad that I do not remember his name.... I have to go back again to Phoenix next month, and have already booked my stay here. I did research hotels again, and despite the deals, etc., this Radisson hotel is the best choice for the location, amenities, and value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Phoenix Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KevinMJM
Reviews.Content: I live in the Phoenix area. However, faced with an early morning flight, there was no way that I was going to get up at 4:30AM, drive fifteen miles or so, search for airport parking, etc. So, thanks to a great deal on Priceline, I spent the night here. Happy Hour the night before was great. Dinner was absolutely delicious. The staff was most courteous. The bed was quite comfortable. The room was quiet. The shuttle bus to the airport left right on time and my car remained parked – safe and sound – in the hotel parking lot for the duration of my trip for $5 per night. Excellent! I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Movinup
Reviews.Content: Very easy place to stay near the airport. We arrived around midnight and had a second flight the next morning. The shuttle from this property runs 24 hours and came to pick us up soon after the luggage came off the carousel. It was a short minibus trip back to the hotel. The room was generously sized and had a separate sofa to form a sitting area. Shuttle service back to the airport was similarly convenient. The front desk clerk was especially helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. They had a quick breakfast option until 6AM when the full service restaurant opened. We didn't stay long enough to explore all of the amenities but the time spent was very pleasant and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, convenient and professional.”
Reviews.Author: farm2099
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say that I am a bit surprise by the quality of this hotel. I wasn't expecting this at all. The staff is nice , they have FREE shuttle 24 hours a day to airport, Free WI-FI, nice outdoor pool and the neighbourood is very quiet. This is a little gem hidden in Phoenix. The room are very nice and very clean. The layout of the room is quite original actually , i really liked it. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtnbiker1
Reviews.Content: We didn't spend much time here but it's very nice. Sleep number beds are nice. Very clean. I would have no hesitation in returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: alibaly
Reviews.Content: I rarely review hotels but felt this one was worth sharing. This a is great hotel all round. Has a lovely clean heated outdoor pool, in nice surroundings, we found it very relaxing. Rooms are spotlessly clean, beds are very comfortable. The front staff were super professional. The guys who do the shuttle to the airport are top class, great banter combined with welcoming and professional approach. Exactly what guests love! Very happy with our stay here, and would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelBob78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located convenient to the airport, Scottsdale, and other Phoenix sites. The front desk was well run offering lots of information in a friendly way. The hotel was clean and well kept. The staff was responsive in answering questions, fixing a locked room safe, and refilling the lobby coffee. Overall, a good value for a moderate level hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: TravelForFunDeerPark
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel. Worked great for staying after flight. Bid for this on Priceline and was happy with the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ian H
Reviews.Content: This stay was a very short one - but the staff were terrific (as they have been on previous stays at this hotel)! The 4:40AM shuttle bus driver was helpful - he had a great sense of humor (needed at 4:40AM - before the chickens were awake, he said!) - and we arrived at PHX in good time to catch the flight! Large, comfortable and quiet rooms made it a good visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Lonny P
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to Stay at the Radisson Hotel Phoenix Airport North. I had an extended business stay (6-days). The staff is the friendliest and most attentive that I have ever encountered. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the the exercise room and business center are available 24/7. I would definately recommend this hotel, a Great Staff and Place to Stay! L.Phillips - Colcord, OK

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChipperBend_OR
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel numerous times. The staff is always friendly and helpful and the rooms are large and comfortable. The pool is quiet and nice and the exercise room is great. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Radisson in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Al F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this facility in February, 2012. The facility was clean, people friendly and food good. I recommend this facility and would stay there again Al Farabee Kennewick, WA

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: asmokc
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Radisson Phoenix Hotel Airport North was for business, but felt like a vacation - the staff were very friendly, extremely attentive, and highly professional. The room was perfect, as well; the Sleep # bed provided a great night's sleep throughout my visit, and the business class room was perfectly designed for a business traveler. I was able to work in the room, uninterrupted by any outside noise, and the amazing breakfast buffet made it easy to get up and going in the morning. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the Phoenix/Scottsdale area. I wouldn't have changed a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: BusTraveler53449
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Phoenix for work. After a long day and flight, I was exhausted. As I approached the front desk, the receptionist greeted me and helped me check in. She was very pleasant and helpful. Her personality was great and she had me laughing. For some reason this is what I needed at that time. Any time I had a question, they were there to help. The staff was great, the food was great and the room was clean and comfortable. I travel often for work and when I come back to Phoenix, I wil make sure I stay here too.

Reviews.Title: “good place for early flight out”
Reviews.Author: bostongolfers
Reviews.Content: Its an average hotel near airport and car rental locations. The Phoenix car rental area is a little far out from the actual airport and this hotel located on 44th street is near-by. Average rooms.Clean. easy in, easy out for a one nighter leaving early from Phoenix sky airport.

Reviews.Title: “Check in staff were best ever”
Reviews.Author: Wilber55
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel close to Airport. Very Friendly and helpful staff. After a full day of travelling they couldn't do enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to go to each night after work”
Reviews.Author: Tcab13
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to from the airport. Convenient to the Oakland A's Muni Stadium where I was working. Not a ton of restaurants around only a few fast food places about a mile or two north up 44th. The breakfast at the hotel served a nice buffet, nothing fancy but enough to get you full and on your way out the door. Wish it was included in the price of the room rate, but the front desk young lady who checked me in gave me a 1 day complimentary breakfast buffet, which was very nice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: DiciPageArizona
Reviews.Content: We recently made a trip to the Phoenix area for an amazing car show in Scottsdale and chose this Radisson from two good previous stays a few years ago. Another priority was the location for meeting family at Sky Harbor airport which was only minutes away. My partner and I chose the King one-bedroom suite which was perfect for what we needed. The room was immaculate, Layout gave us a small living room area complete with a small fridge that held our cheeses and wines. A microwave would have been a nice touch, but at least a coffee maker is included. Other reviews have said the space was tight and cramped. We don't agree - plenty of room for luggage. We would choose this room offering again due to the VERY quiet private bedroom which closes off the living room with an attractive French door and thus - any hallway noises from neighbors slamming their doors or yapping loudly in the hallways late at night. Front desk staff was very friendly, and we used the in-room wi-fi but ALSO enjoyed the business center which offered a printer (fantastic to have!) for airline boarding pass printings. Ate lunch at the restaurant - great service - food was great quality at a reasonable price including a nice beer menu. We know quality - this place has it in their rooms and reliable customer service tops it off nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix Airport Radisson”
Reviews.Author: armedinfidel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff very helpful. 44st Cafe had a limited but very good menu. Sleep number bed, large TV and well appointed rooms. Stayed on business and all attendees had no complaints. Would recommend this facility for a stay. Rate was good for value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Tom173sky
Reviews.Content: Attending mid-winter conference for military organization, Great transportation free from airport to hotel. Staff extremely friendly at all time. Rooms very organized for work or relaxing! Large TV that swivels for fully room viewing! I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Christine L
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly and extremely helpful. They were attentive to our every need. We stayed two nights, upon arrival and departure from the airport, and had such a pleasant time because of the courtesy and kindness of front desk and maintenance/service staff. The breakfast buffet was delicious, especially the waffles. We have a young son and the staff helped to make his travel experience extra-special. We were able to pick up and return our rental car through the hotel front desk, a process that was both stress-free and hassle-free! The airport shuttle is very convenient. We plan to stay here anytime we fly in to Phoenix and we want to recommend this hotel to all travelers!

Reviews.Title: “close to phoenix airport”
Reviews.Author: kino50
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel a couple of times, and found the last time that it was very noisy. People coming in at 3:30 am and woke us up, hallways need updating. Very close to airport and free shuttle was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice......”
Reviews.Author: RDRKRNR
Reviews.Content: This is a well run hotel! Everything was first class. Check-in was a breeze and the front desk agent, Susie, was polite, efficient and knowledgeable. The room was quite nice and extremely clean. The bed was comfortable and the LCD TV was a nice bonus. The hotel is located just a few minutes from the airport and the shuttle ran every twenty minutes, right on the button and the drivers (for my flight out and return flight) were friendly and professional. Hotels like this one make my frequent travels much more bearable - thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch, and close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: The_Old_Podge
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, comfortable, and well maintained. Check-in staff was friendly and courteous. We were permitted to check-in two hours early, and check-out one hour late at no extra charge. The breakfast included in our room-rate package was fresh, hot, and tasty. The hot breakfast buffet included scrambled eggs, hash-browns, bacon, sausage, and waffles. We are very glad we chose this hotel for the last day of our Arizona vacation, and would certainly stay here again if we needed a room close to the airport. -Podge

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great1”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne H
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and easy. Parking was close. Room was very clean and quiet. Food in hotel restaurant was surprisingly good. I didn't use the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: COLO_USA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on business. Comfortable beds, nice linens. Nice pool and hot tub area!

Reviews.Title: “myvacation”
Reviews.Author: Terri P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel, for one night. We were on vacation, and had rented a car and drove to las Vegas, and returned to Phoenix four days later and spent another night at this hotel. We had a very nice stay there. I found the bed to be extremely comfortable! Lots of toiletries,coffee maker in room. ( just when I thought it was pretty standard, there were no coffee maker in the two different hotels I stayed at in Vegas, which were far more expensive!) I found the staff at the front desk, very friendly. Enjoyed the free internet. Both nights there were very nice, would definately recommend this hotel. Very clean, and comfortable! Most definately would return to this hotel, when in the Phoenix area again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: texashu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a two-night business trip. The rooms are clean, and the free wifi was excellent for completing work. I also found the location to be extremely convenient for airport access. I was most impressed by the front desk as they caught an error on my bill at check-out and saved me money. I'd return to this location in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for airline travel - nice place!”
Reviews.Author: luckyparker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we needed to return a rental car and fly home the following day after a vacation. The facility was far nicer than expected, with many amenities. Iced water with lemon slices in the lobby, lots of toiletries, free internet service, comfortable bar and happy hour, ample and easy parking, friendly and helpful staff, upscale desk chair, dreamy bed, free all-hours shuttle service (which we used twice). The location isn't great for any walking sightseeing, but is worth the money for airport convenience. There's even a view of the airport or Camelback Mountain to choose from. I joined the Carlson Club I was so happy with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very convient and comfy”
Reviews.Author: ArbPubProg
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one-night stay. It was super easy to find the hotel, conveniently located and a really short drive to the airport. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Travel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iona96
Reviews.Content: I have overnighted here a couple of times before flying out of Phoenix. From reservations to checking out, it is a great facility. I will stay here whenever the opportunity arises. When reserving a room, there is an option of several different upgrades to sign up for if you wish. Upon checking in, you find out if the option selected is available and pay for it at that time. I opted for an upgrade to a suite and it was wonderful! Room service has an extensive menu and is extremely quick in delivering the meal. Everyone at Radisson Hotel Phoenix Airport is welcoming, helpful and go out of their way to make a person feel comfortable. The hotel itself is impeccable, with lovely decor and easy access to all amenities. I highly recommend staying here to anyone finding themselves looking for a spot to stay in Phoenix. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ROBnVA
Reviews.Content: All staff encountered were very pleasant. Needed to return a rental car to the airport after check-in to avoid issues do to a very early morning flight. The front desk had printed instructions to the car rental return that were most helpful. After a quick rental return and the car rental's shuttle to the airport, the hotel shuttle promptly came to give me a ride back to the hotel. Visit was very short and did not venture out of the hotel for dinner but the hotel restaurant was quite good. Doesn't appear to be much of anything within walking distance Also the weekday lounge happy hour from 4-6pm is a great bargain. Since we had to leave before the the restaurant opened in the morning, they provide a complimentary grab and go selection of fruit, granola bars, coffee, tea and bottled water. As others have said, the rooms with Sleep Number beds are wonderful as well as the design of the room. Very quiet and no airport noises.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Radisson Phoenix Airport”
Reviews.Author: gigipup
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made a great choice by selecting the Radisson Phoenix Airport Hotel. Plush accommodations and a very comfortable bed, excellent service by all we encountered, and a really delicious dinner in their cafe (the grilled citrus salmon). Couldn't ask for more at a very fair price !! Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect travel hotel”
Reviews.Author: mctom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our flight out of Phoenix and it was wonderful. The staff were welcoming, friendly and accomodating. They knew the area (for a quick trip to a pharmacy) and were happy to help with directions. The room was very nice, super clean and the Sleep Number Beds cannot be beat for comfort. We felt like we were staying in a much pricier accomodation. Free hi-speed internet in the room was easy to use and I love that Radisoon doesn't nickel and dime you for every little perk like the bottled water in your room. Makes you feel more comfortable and at home. I love the Radisson/Carlson hotels and this is a superior example of the best the chain has to offer. Shuttle service to and from the airport available and on site dining for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay in Radisson Phoenix Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Billie S
Reviews.Content: My stay in this particular hotel was outstanding - they treated us well and greeted as as friends. I did have a problem with my particulare Number bed and, bless the maintainence man's heart, but he couldn't get it fixed. So, he contacted the front desk and suggested we be assigned another room. No problem to us! We switched - but before the maintainence man left her checked both of the beds - worked just fine. Then he handed us each a coupon for a free breakfast the next day - UNBELEIVEABLE and not needed, honestly. The entire staf was FANTASTIC and yes, we would stay there again. Billie Snell

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: SirRead
Reviews.Content: Easy acess to and from the airport. Comfortable rooms. Loved the soaps and shampoo products. When I commented to the front desk how much I liked them, she immediately offered me extra to take with me. Great coffee and nice continental breakfast complimentary as well as a decent breakfast buffet to purchase. A great value for the price and a quick overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay here”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: The staff and hotel amenities are great. I've stayed here many times and each time it just gets better. The leadership team at this hotel are clearly doing something right. Staff are friendly, accomodating, and have responded quickly to my every need. The facilities are quite good but what makes this hotel stand out are the employees. Rooms are always clean and well kept and I appreciate the little touches that make me feel welcome. Housekeeping, resturant maintenance, and reception staff always greet you warmly and with an accomodating smile. The people who work here make such a difference in my stay that I offer this review.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and "free parking"”
Reviews.Author: twoscratchy
Reviews.Content: We love to stay here before and sometimes after a flight from Phoenix. The hotel is soooo close to the airport and you get 14 nights of parking with the room rate. Excellent shuttle service to and from airport. Parking is secure since it is right in front of the hotel lobby. We have had "problems" in the past with parking in structure(vandalism), so we really like the parking. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are well furnished and beds are excellent. Best place to stay by the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: SSMc_11
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was friendly and helpfull during check-in. I needed a cold place for medication and they had a fridge sent up to the room and suggested I request a fridge in the future when booking a room. I did not realize most hotels offer this service. The room was clean and the bed was so comfortable! I will stay here everytime I have an early flight out of Sky Harbor Intl. Airport.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rudy C
Reviews.Content: I found the Radisson Phoenix Airport North hotel about a year ago on a business trip, and I am glad I did. This hotel is very clean. From the hotel lobby, restaurant, pool and most importantly...the rooms. I feel very safe and comfortable. When I'm away from home, I want to feel comfortable, and this place makes me feel that way. The biggest reason that I return here is the hotel staff. They know the meaning of customer service. These days when that seems to be missing from many service industries, this hotel has it right. I visit the Phoenix area at least once a month, and will only stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: rtoberst
Reviews.Content: Hotel had excellent reviews and the extra 3 miles away from I-10 where we were traveling thru was worth our detour.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant (and needed) surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: I was returning from a vacation at the Grand Canyon where the lodgings were a bit stark (but clean). I had not stayed at a Radisson Hotel in years and was a bit wary considering the online price I paid--about $70! The website promised me a comfortable bed (a sleep number bed), and I needed that very much after five nights at the Grand Canyon lodge. What a great surprise! The hotel was easy to find, and I got a parking space right out front! The registration person was friendly, helpful, and fast. I was in my room in no time. And what a great room! The bed was marvelously comfortable, and the room had a great work/relaxing area (with a flat screen television)--and free Internet! Everything was very clean as well. Needless to say, I had a wonderful night's sleep and felt refreshed and ready to face the long flight home the next day.Without a doubt, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: manyhatwoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights while attending a conference downtown at convention center. The staff here is TOP NOTCH! We were picked up at airport by shuttle driver, shuttle would carry us to light rail stop, CVS, almost anywhere close by... The breakfast buffet was AWESOME! Housekeeping wonderful! Lobby staff friendly and accommodating! I have a sleep number bed and these were not as wonderful as mine at home but still ok (wish beds were queen or king instead of full)... Shampoo and conditioner scent not the greatest but husband loved the soap! Wish they had laundry facilities and also refrigerators in every room. Kids went to pool but didn't stay long as the water was too warm. Otherwise, loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CdotM
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel on two recent trips to Phoenix. The property is well kept, the rooms are comfortable, and the restaurant is great. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: purcfin
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before early morning flight.. Outstanding value particularly at price paid through a travel site. Did not eat at the hotel, but the room was well appointed. Light rail just a short distance to the south so convenient for travel to Chase Field events.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Ffoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the nite before we left for vacation, and parked are car while we were away. The hotel offers a Stay and Park package the it very reasonable, and also offers and airport shuttle. The staff was very friendly and helpful about when we need to leave for the airport. Now the room it was a perfect way to start are vacation, it was very clean they had the temperature set low which was very refreshing after coming in from 116 degree weather. Beds were very comfortable and they had a large flat screen t.v. looked like a 42". Instead of dinner they had a Happy Hour Menu so we had drinks and appetizers that were very good. Looking forward to the next time we can get down there. Nicest Hotel we have stayed out in a while.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mesocyclone2011
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for more. Was flying through Sky Harbor and wanted to visit a friend in Phoenix for the night. This place was extremely convenient to the airport and also the light rail to get to Tempe and back. Front desk service (plus the FREE airport shuttle drivers) were efficient and courteous. The room itself was extremely clean and comfortable, with the business-style desk a nice touch. There was also a pretty good view of a midnight dust storm (hehe) out my 7th floor window. I got a truly fantastic rate by bidding on Priceline...and certainly got more than my money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Close To Airport”
Reviews.Author: Mayoman111
Reviews.Content: This Hotel offers good value for money accomodation close to the airport. The room was a good standard, clean, spacious and well appointed. Buffet breakfast was a very good standard and excellent value. Would not hesitate to stay hear again upon arrival or departure from Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: livinontherock
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night here on my way back home from Sedona. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Shuttle service made my life much easier by allowing me to drop my rental car off the night before my flight to save me some early morning driving. They picked me up at the airport. Shuttle leaves every 20 minutes from the hotel to the airport which is very very close. Very convenient. Pool and area was spacious and clean, Rooms were well appointed with sleep number beds and nice linens. I wasn't so sure as I made my way down the hallway of the 6th floor. The carpet and paint was really worn. Fitness room was very clean and well equipped with the latest equipment, tv, earphones, water. Restaurant was pretty nice although the muzak, plus 2 televisions on two different channels made it a little too casual and noisy than necessary. The lobby bar offered a nice happy hour although I did not take advantage. Overall, a good experience here.

Reviews.Title: “If we're ever back in Phoenix, we'll stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: NLLCamden_Maine_USA
Reviews.Content: What made our stay in Phoenix so nice was the staff at the Radisson. Manager Matt Ezor and front desk staff, Nicole, went beyond the call of duty. The online booking service who originally took my prepaid reservation had said that breakfast vouchers were included. That turned out not to be true. But a call to the hotel before we arrived got that straightened out, thanks to Matt. He also was very gracious when we went off and left a suit in our hotel room closet, as was the housekeeping and lost and found staff. Nicole was very knowledgeable about what to see in the Phoenix area, and suggested a couple of very nice restaurants. The hotel also offers free shuttle service that was appreciated when we needed a ride back from the Botanical Gardens. The full breakfast buffet was a welcomed treat each morning, too. And the free parking was a plus as we had a rental car. Only one minor complaint- the supper we had in the Cafe our first evening was only medicore. But overall, great location (walking distance to the Light Rail) and even better staff who appreciated our business.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisitely accommodated two night hotel needs on a last minute, tight, late, and exhausting cross country air travel.”
Reviews.Author: JLPTaylor
Reviews.Content: The staff members were excellent! They were friendly and answered all my questions clearly and succinctly. The hotel was conveniently located off the freeway and was very close to the airport. This was great owing to my very late check-in, need for a comfortable, quiet, quick, and restful sleep before waking around 3:00 AM for a 6:00 AM flight departure to the east coast. What made the travel complete was upon returning to my room the next day, it was clean and fresh. I sleep so well before leaving for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Pinehurst067
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay near the airport. Shuttles every 20 minutes, friendly staff, room was very clean and spacious, and - surprise, surprise - we ordered room service in the evening being too tired to go out. The food was excellent!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: coquicola412
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night so we'd be at the airport for our flight the next morning. This hotel is about a mile from the airport and even has a free shuttle every 20 minutes. Safe business park neighborhood. Gentleman at check-in was very personable. Suite was spacious and comfortable. Sleep number bed was comfy too. Had a great stay and I'd recommend the hotel to anyone! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “No airport noise, quiet, friendly place.”
Reviews.Author: mary1138
Reviews.Content: We ended up here bc the hilton garden inn airport north was booked. Only 2 miles from the 10 fwy so good for travelling through. Very quiet, great for sleeping. Cafe in lobby good for convenient dinner esp since not much nearby. Clean bathroom, clean comfy sleep number bed, very hot water in shower so watch out. Overall I would stay here again. Room service avail till 10pm. Bar lounge in lobby was cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Great when you need to be near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Essie14
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Phoenix at 11 PM and did not want to start driving at the Grand Canyon at night, so I pricelined an airport hotel and got the Radisson. The room was very clean and comfortable, the sleep number bed was great. Front desk staff was very nice. I didn't use the business center or the pool. I did use the fitness room which was really nice, for a hotel. Everything was great for what I needed!

Reviews.Title: “nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Irishray
Reviews.Content: We were traveling a lot in AZ and had this as a 2 day stop over, it was a nice surprise, people were friendly, it was clean, food was good, great location, we did not expect such a nice place

Reviews.Title: “A terrible night with Radisson”
Reviews.Author: jmpotts
Reviews.Content: I stayed with this particular property on November 2, 2010. I went to check in to the front desk and a guest service member by the name of Elizabeth was working by herself. I didn’t have any credit cards because my wallet had been recently stolen, and the airline had booked me a room at this property because my connecting flight was canceled. I did however, have a check and she wouldn’t take that as a deposit either? I have traveled around and worked for a Hilton so I know hotels can take a check as a deposit, photo-copy my drivers license (which I had along with my checkbook), and even call a tele-check service to confirm the check was good. She showed no interest in trying to help me and then called Julien [--] the front Office Manager, who was not even present and had to speak to via phone. Julien was very combative and showed an extreme lack of respect for my situation. He didn’t offer any solutions. I became very upset over this. I had not chosen this hotel, it was the hotel the airline used for distressed passengers, and they were not able to accommodate guests in this condition. I was unable to sleep a decent amount of time because of all of this. The room and tax was paid for by the airline. So I ask: why are the staff not trained to read the situation of a guest? Why can’t they take a check as a deposit? There is no excuse. I have also written the airline and recommended that they discontinue using this hotel for this type of service. I will never stay at this hotel chain every again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: carriegauvreau
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our trip to Tucson to be close to the airport when we flew out the next morning. The room was clean and modern. It had a king size Sleep Number bed with wireless remotes which was a nice surprise. It had a large LCD TV in the room and free Wifi. One down side was that the air conditioner was very loud and prevented us from getting to sleep for a while. It was a cozy room and we could have stayed longer if we had the air conditioner fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight, but wouldn't want to make this my base camp”
Reviews.Author: ncmom51
Reviews.Content: We flew into Phoenix and got in around 10 pm. After securing a car it was very late when we got to the hotel. The clerk at the desk was very nice...in fact, our room had been booked for 1 king size bed (?) and I told him since I was traveling with 2 teenage boys I needed 2 beds. No problem. The beds are sleep beds ...which I know nothing about but my boys had fun filling and sinking their bed. The rooms are clean, but dated. Great service from the clerk again with handing me menus of a pizza delivery service. My boys devoured the pizza and said it was wonderful. Left early the next morning. Plenty of towel, did see a business center but didn't use.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you need to be close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: treess126
Reviews.Content: Phoenix was my connecting city and I had missed my flight to Minneapolis because of bad weather, it was a good price on priceline, it was ok

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and value and close to resturants”
Reviews.Author: carl1881
Reviews.Content: we were heading to Hawaii for Pittsburgh so we broke up the flight and stopped in phoenix . the hotel was excellent and very competitively priced. we also stopped on the way home. we will use this hotel anytime going to phoenix in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly nice hotel for a good value!”
Reviews.Author: GrandFan13
Reviews.Content: We live in Phoenix suburb but decided to stay in town for fun to catch a flight the next day. We didn't want to spend too much but did want a clean, nice hotel and after reading reviews, we opted to try this Radisson. Don't recall that we've ever stayed at a Radisson but we would highly recommend this one. Our nightly rate was average but it included $40 worth of coupons for the hotel restaurant or room service, making it a good value. Not only were we pleasantly surprised with the quality and appearance of our room (nice desk area and layout, great sleep-number bed) but the restaurant was excellent. We ate dinner and breakfast there and the menu not only offered great choices but the food quality and presentation was wonderful. Restaurant and front-desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is very close to airport and freeway but very quiet. All-in-all, this is a great choice and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the nicest Radisson I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ExpeditionMan
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Phoenix Radisson, my associate always stays there. The rooms were quite nice and larger than I expected, I had the king bed. The office desk and layout worked out great for me as I had to do a few hours of office work and I was quite comfortable. The wireless worked well and was pretty darn quick. The lobby/bar was surprisingly busy and had a nice energy. The exercise room was small but had what I needed. I didn't swim but saw several people using the outdoor pool. My room was very clean and I really liked the king bed. My neighbors showed up late both evenings I was there and were rather loud and kept the tv on all evening, some people's lack of common courtesy amazes me. The airport shuttle 'only' started at 5 am so I had to get up and drop off my associate with our rental vs. sleeping in for a couple of hours before my flight, a little hassle. There were just a couple of nearby restaurants and we drove about 10 minutes to the Tempe Marketplace which had a lot of restaurants to choose from and for us was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the Stay and cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: nothinken
Reviews.Content: I never been to Phoenix before, so booking a hotel was a bit concerning. However my stay here at the Radisson, was outstanding. I had a very nice room, free Wifi, which was great as I was able to keep up with work. Since it was only myself, I tend to by habit not to have a maid waste her time to freshen my room, since I was gone all day, however when I seen them in the hall way they offered me more bottle water and coffee. This hotel was great, I slept well, enjoyed my view, was in a nice area, and I actually sat outside to watch sunsets and just take in the desert coming from Michigan I sent many pictures back. I am staying there again, next month, and I plan on going a couple days earlier this time so I can enjoy it. I also thought the shuttle service was outstanding. Arriving at the airport, I called the hotel, who told me where to wait for them, and on the way to the hotel the driver actually drove me by the place I had to be at for my business and made sure I knew how to get there as it was a very short walk. The only complaint I had was no outside bar, funny, but I did manage to be outside as much as possible. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Rude un organized”
Reviews.Author: baseball4u
Reviews.Content: Out of the 5 rooms we had booked only 2 were correct. How did they fix this? they didnt, all they did was send in rollaway beds at extra charge. These rooms were booked 2 months in advance. The staff was rude except a few people. The food and beverage staff were the best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: cckc1968
Reviews.Content: We came into town for a family event. Many extended family also in town so we had different people in our room each night. My husband and I and our toddler slept in the room our entire stay, but our teenage daughter, our adult son, and our teenage nephew, took turns staying with us too. Hotel seems on the older side, but very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The airport is close, but airplane noise was not a problem. We had Sleep Number beds in our room, but one did not work. The beds were on the small side and fire codes prevented us from getting a rollaway in our room (double occupancy). Shuttle service to the airport was reliable, my son flew out and needed an early shuttle, the airport is less than 5 min away. Parking was good and our vehicle seemed safe. There is an onsite restaraunt, but we did not eat there and there is a bar in the lobby, classy looking not a rough hang out. TV in our room was kind of snowy. We had a guy come in and try and fix it, but it didn't help. They changed out our TV the next day, but it didn't completely fix the problem. Wireless is free and internet worked well. Light Rail is within walking distance, but we did not use it either.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was simply awesome!”
Reviews.Author: sdavis144
Reviews.Content: My three daughters and I were on our way to Disneyland (from Texas) and we knew that we couldn't drive the entire distance on one day, so we decided to stop in Phoenix. We chose the Radisson because every stay that I have ever had with the hotel chain has been great and this hotel did not disappoint. The place was easily accessible, especially with my GPS and had shopping and eating places relatively close. The hotel was beautiful, had a great staff and lovely rooms. We were treated very well by all and just enjoyed it a lot. I was actually sad that we could only stay the one night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and near Airport”
Reviews.Author: Bobkatevan
Reviews.Content: A nice clean hotel room. Stayed near airport for early takeoff. Close to airport and would stay again. We tried the sleep number beds, but we kept them too soft and ended up not liking them, next time we'll try a higher number.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best bet”
Reviews.Author: bozhawg
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of days. We did not get towels when they cleaned after the first nights stay, and they took the old towels away. They left a pizza box and never gave us clean glasses. I complained, they only gave us towels. I complained again when checking out and then they offered a free breakfast. But of course we had no time and had to go to the airport. The resturant is very expensive, but the food was good. The room was very small, but did have a couch and a desk and chair. Our room was on the 2nd floor and looked right at the air conditioner or heater. not sure which, not a view at all.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: 4richer4poorer
Reviews.Content: Great staff, super clean and modern, great location, even a good onsite restaurant with fair prices. What more could you want for this rate class?

Reviews.Title: “good price”
Reviews.Author: PaTraveler7251
Reviews.Content: Good price & close to airport. Sleep number bed deflated on my side. Room a little cramped because of large coffee table. Bathroom had no fan and door hit toliet. Restaurant had captive audience if you don't want to venture out to find a place to eat. High prices and not a big selection. Over all nice place, next time I won't take sleep number bed.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for beginning of our trip”
Reviews.Author: katrienduck
Reviews.Content: great hotel when you arrive at phoenix airport. Shuttle is very easy, and we went next day with shuttle again to airport for our rental car. Bed was very good, excellent stay

Reviews.Title: “Close and convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: enakpil
Reviews.Content: The sleep number bed is a bit overrated. As a solo traveler, I like having a king size bed all to myself so I had to adjust both sides of the bed to the same setting. the problem is that the settings on the bed adjust in increments of 5 so getting both sides of the bed exactly even takes some trial and error. You can decrease or increase firmness for a full 5 seconds without changing the number at all but you can definitely feel the difference. Some people might like the bed but it is not the top of the line bed; it feels a bit like sleeping on an air mattress. The room is situated differently than most hotel rooms as the head of the bed is on the wall adjoining the bathroom so you have a view of the window straight ahead. The lounge/cafe/bar was really my only choice for food since I didn't have a vehicle but the food was decent and the service was good as it's too far to walk anywhere else. **Make sure to call the hotel when you arrive to have them send their shuttle to pick you up. There are two Radissons in the area so make sure you get the right number. In terminal 4, the courtesy phones only calls the OTHER Radisson so bring the phone number with you.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaReneM
Reviews.Content: Great staff and great service.. The Hotel never lets me down.

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY NICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: vYrb
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were looking at a great hotel to stay in that was close to the Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport. We came upon the Radisson Hotel. We went to the website and was very pleased at what we saw. The selling point was the Sleep Number Bed. Once we arrived (in the 1st room) I was looking for the remote to the bed and come to find out it wasn't a room with the Sleep Number Bed. Then I called front desk to find out if any rooms were available with the Sleep Number Bed and she was more than happy to accommodate me. She said all I had to do was come back to the front desk to get the Key to the room. The new room was two doors down from the previous. The room was very clean and the decor was eye pleasing. The computer chair at the desk was so comfortable I wanted to take it home LOL. The bathroom was VERY clean not a single strand of hair was on the floor and mirror was spotless. The 2nd day of my stay I had my jacket dry cleaned so I dropped it off at 8 and was informed that my jacket would be ready around 6pm. I had planned on leaving the room at 6:30 but couldn't and I didnt receive my jacket until 7! Another thing was that the water from the bathroom sink was too hot. Before we left to go out on the town we ask the front desk clerks what events was going on for the night and all pitched in with events which was very helpful. They even informed us about the forms of transportation offered in the area. My final morning we had breakfast at the buffet and we were greeted with a smile by the hostess. Breakfast was very good but the pancakes were hard so I opted for the Waffles which was self served (waffle iron on the buffet line). They had a great selection of breakfast items and drinks available. One thing I really liked was the express check-out. When I woke up on my last morning, my receipt was slid under the door. I didn't have to go to the desk to check-out but if I had a discrepancy or anything then that would be the only reason to go there. This was my 1st time staying in the Radisson Hotel and would definately go back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory with a plus”
Reviews.Author: iBike
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location close to Sky Harbor. Shuttle very timely, efficient staff. Decent food from restaurant. Our breakfast server was great, she really put the plus on what would otherwise have been a nice stay. The property was very clean. Not a big fan of the sleep number beds. Overall we were pleased and we would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: RobMichelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights for business and one for pleasure. Great staff, unique room layout was perfect. Very convenient location. My wife left some clothes in a drawer which we didn't realize until we got home. The staff was very helpful and mailed them to us at no charge. I recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for airport stopover, airport shuttle, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TriciaMc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night, flew in from the UK and returned to the airport the next day to get a bus to Flagstaff., so we didn't have a car. We phoned for the hotel shuttle bus from the free phone in the airport, which was easy to find (with some help, there are people in the airport employed to stand around being helpful, which is welcome after the 1.5 hour queue for immigration) and it arrived within 10-15 mins as promised, the journey took 5 mins. In the morning the shuttle left every 20 mins. The room was big, comfortable and clean, same for the bed (sleep number - what's the big deal? it's just a firm but comfortable bed), there was a wetroom shower which worked well. There is a restaurant and room service in the hotel if you need it, we didn't use it. The $10.95 breakfast was really nice, with fresh fruit, porridge, bagels, waffles as well as bacon, sausage etc. There was a PC and printer in the lobby, but don't leave it till 8am to print your boarding pass, you won't be the only one. A great place to stay for a quick stopover. The location would probably not be great for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: kruizerkarol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2/10/08, very nice stay. Booked through Priceline but no mention of Priceline at check in. We were on 3rd floor, king bed, overlooking a/c unit and parking structure but no noise from either. Loved the Sleep Number bed. Room was clean except a tissue on the floor in the bathroom behind the garbage can and when searching for my shoe I lifted up the bedskirt and there was lots of junk under there, like they don't vacuum very well underneath things. But countertops were ok and bath & bed linens were fine. When we first went down the hallway I wondered if the room was really going to be a non-smoking as the hall reeked of smoke but the room was fine, no smoke smell. We had breakfast in the restaurant. We ordered from the ala carte menu as we didn't want the whole $11 buffet breakfast and it was okay. Front desk staff were always very pleasant. It was handy that they had a computer and printer right in the lobby for guests to use free of charge. I could print out my boarding pass. Wireless internet worked fine (but I don't carry a printer). Didn't use the shuttle as we had a rental car. You are a long way from the rental car return at this hotel, I think if you rent a car it might be better to stay at a downtown hotel, seemed closer. Or, take your car back the night before.

Reviews.Title: “nice enough”
Reviews.Author: chitownflyfisher
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, everything here is just fine except for the location. If this hotel was on the beach somewhere or in the mountains it would be real nice. We thought we lost our camera and called the hotel and they had us leave a voice mail for the lost and found. Well antonio called the next day to let us know they had not found it. Pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “good for a weekend...but needs some work”
Reviews.Author: podoho
Reviews.Content: stayed for a weekend - hotel is starting to show its age and use - clean, quiet - bathroom sink backed up, staff there in less than 5 minutes to address it - only problem was that all night long the sound of water backflowing from somewhere else into our bathroom sink pipe was going on as well - I think it's time to upgrade this place - maybe some new paint, new sinks (ours had a crack in it) - overall, an OK place to stay if you want to be near the airport - I've stayed here several times and overall the experience is OK to above average - oh yes, they also need more than one person at the front desk during high-usage checkout time - my compliments to Michele, a very nice front desk person - but she needs more help, especially when you have several people checking out all at once in a hurry to get to the airport -

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: OceanLove3
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for $70 a night on Priceline. We only stayed here one night. We drove here from San Diego after being in SD for 5 nights. We wish we stayed in SD. Phoenix is extremely boring, with nothing to do. The downtown area is filled with homeless people and just very dull. We will definitely not be returning to Phoenix ever again. San Diego is amazing. As for the hotel, it's in the airport zone, so it's convenient if you have a flight to catch, but didn't matter for us. If you're not used to hearing planes all night, you might have trouble sleeping. The staff is very friendly and check in was quick. There is no hot water in the shower, it only gets lukewarm. The beds are very uncomfortable (sleep number). Many people like sleep number beds but I find them to be very uncomfortable. There is a fitness center that consists of 2 elliptical trainers, a treadmill and some machine that's supposed to simulate weight training. Would have been better if they put a rack of dumbells in the place of the machine. The pool was still open, but we didn't use it since it's freezing here. Overall, if you're coming to Phoenix for a vacation, I would seriously reconsider another location, like San Diego. But if you're just driving through like we did, you can see that there really is nothing to see.

Reviews.Title: “More negatives than positives”
Reviews.Author: MrBunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed two separate times during October. My observations: 1. SHUTTLE: If you stay at the Radisson near the airport and call for a shuttle, MAKE SURE you tell the driver you are staying at the Radisson Airport North. There are two Radisson hotels near the airport, and the driver did not ask us about which hotel we were registered--we had no idea there were two of them! When the shuttle arrived (after two calls), he took us to the WRONG Radisson hotel. I would have normally just stayed at the hotel where we were taken, but since I booked a special deal, I was obligated to stay at Radisson Airport North. The driver then did not want to drive us to the correct hotel. After 45 minutes of waiting at the"other" Radisson, his manager convinced him to take us to the Airport North. 2. SHUTTLE PART 2: There is no 24 hour free shuttle at this hotel. They begin the shuttle service at 5 am, so if you have a 6 am flight you better plan on spending $15 for a 3 mile taxi ride. 3. CUSTOMER SERVICE: The second time I stayed here the front desk clerk was outside smoking a cigarette. After 5 minutes of puffing away he showed up and checked us in. While I don't have a degree in Hotel Management, I thought this was unacceptable---especially since he was in full view of the front desk from his smoking area outside. 3. ROOMS: Clean and comfortable. The rooms come with a "Sleep Number" bed so you can adjust the bed to your liking. 4. BREAKFAST BUFFET/RESTAURANT/LOUNGE: It wasn't free, but the breakfast buffet had a good selection of hot and cold food. Service in the restaurant (both dinner and breakfast) was good. The lounge also had good, attentive staff. While the rooms were comfortable and I genuinely liked the restaurant and its staff, those components don't make up for waiting 45 minutes for a shuttle driver to take us to the correct hotel or a front desk clerk who attaches more importance to his cigarette than his job. I'll be going to Phoenix several times per year, but will probably choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: SPaPP
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel close to the airport followinga latish arrival at Phoenix from London. Following a very long delay at Immigration because their computers had crashed we finally reached the hotel at about 8 p.m. Parking was plentiful and check in very efficient. We were very please with the size and cleanliness of our room. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. Room service arrived within the promised 20 minutes and the food was very good. Check out the following morning was equally swift. All in all this hotel is highly recommended by us.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danielle75
Reviews.Content: I would not have chosen to stay here but it was booked for me and I was pleasantly surprised. I liked the desk and the Aeron desk chair. Room service was fast and pretty good. The beds are Sleep Number by Select Comfort and I didn't find them that comfortable, despite all of the people on commercials who kvell about them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Scout44
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews and was NOT disappointed. The staff at this location is great, especially Jahanna (Assistant Front Office Manager). The location is easy to get to/from the airport so it's great if you're going to be in and out of the city quickly. Rooms were clean and very comfortable. It's an awesome place at a great price. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay when in/out of Phoenix Airport”
Reviews.Author: Isle 'n Sun
Reviews.Content: Very nice room. Pool good size. Exercise Room very nice (tad small) Very good service Eat at Restaurant and pleased with food for price

Reviews.Title: “Fine for nondisabled guests, problematic for those of us with disabilities.”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaGrandparents
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and the stay was a better than average experience. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful but didn't always give us correct information. The computer in the lobby was a wonderful extra. We are used to that amenity in Best Westerns and it's one of the reasons we often choose Best Westerns when we are traveling. This is the first time I've seen this at a Radisson and it meant we didn't have to lug our own computer and could still stay in touch with work email. The room was clean and comfortable. But the disability accommodations in the shower that were extremely problematic. The built-in tile seat at the end of the shower farthest from the shower head and controls was a bit too far to be reached by the shower head on the hose. The shower head on the hose was so difficult to turn on and to figure out how to turn on that we had to call the maintenance person -- who couldn't figure out how to turn it on, either. Finally, my husband figured it out -- accidentally. The shower curtain wasn't long or wide enough to contain the water and so the floor got flooded. There was always ice water in the lobby and that was wonderful because it was so incredibly hot outside. Although I had made a special call directly to the hotel to make sure that the disability accommodations would work for us and to make sure that we would have a fridge waiting for our medications and that all feather pillows had been removed, when we arrived there were feather pillows on the bed, no fridge, and the shower had the problems I mentioned above. AND they had no record of my calls and requests. VERY annoying -- but, alas, very common. Still, the staff responded as quickly as they could to the problems, corrected them as well as they were able, and made sure to give us a first floor room. Nice people on the staff but not trained to deal with guests with disabilities, only technically in ADA compliance. But we would stay here again because most hotels are no better in terms of disability issues and often not as nice as this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice~”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaZ
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal through priceline(bidding) and this hotel is great. It has clean room, comfortable bed, & friendly staff. Free internet access is a big plus! A Chinese grocery store & several chinese restaurants are within the walking distance (even under the heat!) We really enjoy the stay! The only complain is that their TV is not working properly. The sound & image can't match.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoCoSandy
Reviews.Content: This was a Great hotel. We loved it. Clean spacious room. Nice pool. Helpful staff. Free internet in the lobby. Pleasant overall stay. Someone mentioned that it's not close to anything besides the airport---that's true. We stayed here to catch a morning flight out. I woudln't recommend it as a home-base for a Phoenix vacation but it was a really great place for us to stay on the end of an Arizona vacation that included Phoenix, Sedona and Williams. We really liked this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place and quiet on the weekend.”
Reviews.Author: tampabobl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to a flight out the next morning. The place was excellent in every way. Room was spacious and clean as was the entire hotel. No breakfast provided but they did have free coffee and free internet access. Only drawback was no good restaurants closeby. I used the website where you bid for a room. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suprise!”
Reviews.Author: TripAdviceTucson
Reviews.Content: I don't usually use Priceline, but what a nice surprise getting this 3-star hotel near the airport for less than $70. I read that some got it for $50, so next time I may bid lower. Since I was flying out the next morning this place was the best. The shuttle was fast and friendly. So was check in (mine was fast: no line and there were 2 employees at the desk). I was very impressed with the rooms. They were clean with nice bathrooms and that sleep number bed is a dream. There was also free wi-fi which is very impressive for any hotel not to tack on an additional charge. Since I was tired, I did the quick walk to the Chinese cultural center and had dinner at the bar at the Golden Buddha. This is not your typical Chinese restaurant: the clams in spicy garlic sauce were amazing! So was the crispy quail appetizer. Also, the bartender (I think his name was Patrick) was very friendly and made my evening a pleasure (especially having to dine alone!). Btw, I highly recommend staying at a SAS/Radisson when in Europe. I stayed at one at the Manchester, England airport and was really impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Wow this is a Radisson?”
Reviews.Author: Derrico
Reviews.Content: In my personal opinion, I usually find Radisson hotels to be the bottom of the three star class. They look ok from a distance but when you get up close they are brimming with problems. This was a pleasant exception. This is a very nice three star hotel. All of the staff I encountered was friendly and helpful. The room was almost perfectly clean (and I think there is no better complement for a hotel than that) The forward Hilton-like space maximizing design of the room was nice as well. The sleep number bed was great. The shuttle to the airport takes eight minutes (I timed it) One other great thing about this place is the proximity to this Asian cultural center food area/office complex two blocks north of the hotel. It is hard to see from the road. When you get past the Chinese garden and walk in the arches you discover a whole asian mall full of Chinese restaraunts and a vietnamese superstore. The only problems I could see would have to be the lack of a business center. That is pretty inexcusable for an "airport" hotel. Especially since they can make it pay for itself if they want to. Another issue might be the staffing at the counters. They were nice, but they really needed a couple of extra people when I was there. The line was too long, but I was only there one night, might have been a fluke. All in all a great place. I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: NMtravelertoo
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, inside and out. It had friendly staff that asked each time you went by the desk if they could be of assistance and I had a very comfortable room. I was concerned though that the tub drained slowly and I could feel the soap scum from previous bathers. I told the desk staff directly about the problem and they were very courteous, appropriately apologetic and very prompt to get someone to snake the drain, but no one ever cleaned the tub. I took a shower the next day. The hotel otherwise looks and feels very comfortable and the staff responsive enough that I would certainly try it again to see if this was just an exception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachmiker
Reviews.Content: WOW!!... What a great Hotel. Stayed 3 nights around a stay in Cancun last week. The sleep number bed was great as well as the shower. Really nice check-in with Eric, what a professional he is. The bartender Dan was a really nice guy (Dan). Put up with this USC Trogan fan! The whole staff was nice also. Pool was nice with big towels. Will visit here again soon..

Reviews.Title: “Ok, a good Priceline (low cost) choice”
Reviews.Author: Masonpips
Reviews.Content: We had late flights in so we stayed here via Priceline prior to heading to the Grand Canyon. Our kids were exhausted so we put them to bed immediately (it was 1 a.m. our time) and unpacked. I went into the bathroom and the toilet was overflowing. We called down immediately and it took 4 phone calls to get someone up there. The thing was POURING out water. We then had to change rooms (opposite end of hall, would it kill them to move you nearby in these circustances?) and it was fine from there on out. We were in the place less than 12 hours in total, so for the price we paid ($62 + taxes) it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 2+ star rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Homergirl
Reviews.Content: This was just a jump off point for us. Our flight landed at 10:30pm and instead of driving to our resort in Scottsdale we opted to stay close to the airport for some rest. We got the hotel for $50 on price line so I can't complain too much, but it was just an average "hotel" stay with the general houskeeping/front desk issues. The room was not a sleep number bed which we were told it would be, it overlooked the airport and massive air conditioning units on the roof (not a big deal, we were only there to sleep) and the room was pretty unkept for being a "clean room" the bottled water they provide was half empty and never replaced, the bathroom floor still had hair and misc paper in corners, bathtub needed a scrub, the coffeemaker still dirty from last guest and the bed, although made, seemed oddly not fresh, as if they never changed the sheets....kinda skeevy but I chalked it up and went to bed. When we checked in, everything was closed and we were starving (by the way we found it odd for the bar to be closed at 11pm on saturday night in a large city like this), so we ordered take out at a nearby italian place who delivered to our room in about 45 minutes. As previous guests mentioned, the AC units are SO LOUD. You can't even hear yourself think when it is going, but the room was too warm not to have it on so we had to put pillows over our heads to sleep. The airplane wasn't even that noisy...it was terrible. I would say that this hotel has been way over rated here on tripadvisor and that it is a great hotel if you can get it for $50 a night on priceline, but if you paid regular rack rate at $149 it isn't worth it. Overall a basic hotel room worth about $50 a night, which is what we paid so....as it goes, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Convenitent to airport, overpriced, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: BocaBlocks
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is convenient to the airport. Desk staff were clueless when we asked for recommendations for fine dining. Management should provide them with list of restaurants, menus & driving directions. AC in room was unbearably noisy. Could not hear TV when it came on & woke us up several times during the night. Noticed that there are a number of other national chain suite hotels nearby for less $ with breakfast, a nice convenience if you have an early flight to catch.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but don't understand the raves”
Reviews.Author: CathySEdmondsWA
Reviews.Content: We reserved a double/double and were given a king. Nice room, but it wasn't going to work for the three of us. The desk quickly switched our room, but the new room was a bit crowded. There were used towels in the bathroom as well as clean ones - obviously not cleaned well. I didn't have the energy to move to yet another room. The restaurant felt pretty deserted, cold and impersonal. We didn't get one of the great deals that some other reviews have mentioned, but I can't blame that on the hotel. Okay stay, but I'm guessing there might be some better choices near the airport.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Hotel Phoenix Airport North
HotelInfo.Address: 427 North 44th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85008
